Reformats the rules

Source: R/global.R
reformat_rules.Rd

This function is responsible for handling the rule reformating, dataset handling and foreign key checks.

Usage

reformat_rules(rules, data_formatted, zip_data = NULL)

Arguments

rules

A data.frame containing rules to be reformatted.

data_formatted

A named list of data.frames with data.

zip_data

A file path to a zip folder with additional data to check.

Value

A data.frame with reformatted rules.

Examples

data("test_rules")
data("valid_example")
reformat_rules(rules = test_rules, data_formatted = valid_example)

#>  3:         particle_SampleID_fk

#>  1:                                                                     Online identifier for methodology needs to be a foreign key
#>  2:                                                                     Online identifier for methodology needs to be a foreign key
#>  3:                                                                                  Unique ID for sample needs to be a foreign key
#>  4:                                                       Unique ID for Sample, values must be unique and non missing in this table
#>  5:                                                                                               Online identifier for methodology
#>  6:                                                                                    Device used to collect sample and dimensions
#>  7:                                                                                 Is there HEPA air filtration system in the lab?
#>  8:                                                                      What is the type of HEPA air filtration system in the lab?
#>  9:                                                                                  Is synthetic clothing restricted from the lab?
#> 10:                                                                  Are synthetic materials restricted from contacting the sample?
#> 11:                                                                         Is a sealed environment used to minimize contamination?
#> 12:                                                                                                Type of sealed environment used?
#> 13:                                                                                                  Mesh sizes of seives used (um)
#> 14:                                                                                                            Filter material type
#> 15:                                                                                      Diameter of filter in mm must not be blank
#> 16:                                                                                                        Diameter of filter in mm
#> 17:                                                                                                          Filter pore size in um
#> 18:                                                                                                          Filter pore size in um
#> 19:                                                                     Visual confirmation methods used e.g. visual microscopy SEM
#> 20:                                                                                               Software used for visual analysis
#> 21:                                                                                                        Picked wet or picked dry
#> 22:                                                        Magnification of the microscope during the visual image in times e.g. 40
#> 23:                                                                         Material identification method e.g. pygcms, raman, ftir
#> 24:                                                                                                       Material ID software used
#> 25:                                       MethodDetectionLimit must be the limit of detection in number of particles for the method
#> 26:                                                      SpikedCount must be the number of plastic particles spiked into the sample
#> 27:                                                                                     Unique ID for each particle cannot be blank
#> 28:                                                                                      Unique ID for each particle must be unique
#> 29:                                                                               Online identifier for methodology cannot be blank
#> 30:                                                                            Online identifier for methodology must end with .pdf
#> 31:                               Online identifier for methodology must be a url address beginning with ftp, http, https, or www. 
#> 32:                                                                                                            Unique ID for sample
#> 33:                                                                                               URL address for photo of particle
#> 34:                                                              URL address for photo of particle is mandatory and cannot be blank
#> 35:                                                    URL address for photo of particle must start with ftp, http, https, or www. 
#> 36:                                                          URL address for spectra of particle is mandatory and cannot be blank. 
#> 37: URL address for spectra of particle must link to a document with type csv, asp, spa, spc, jdx, rds, qs, json, yaml, zip, or 0-9
#> 38:                                                   URL address for spectra of particle must start with ftp, http, https, or www.
#> 39:                                                                          The date the analysis for the particle was finalized. 
#> 40:                                                                                        Any comments about the particle analysis
#> 41:                                                                                                           Particle polymer name
#> 42:                                                                                                             Particle morphology
#> 43:                                                                                                                  Particle color

#> 45:                                                                                           Particle size shortest dimension (um)

#> 47:                                                                                                              Particle mass (mg)
#> 48:                                                                                          Particle projected surface area (um^3)
#> 49:                                                                                                       Particle projected volume
#> 50:                                                                                                       Particle tactile features
#> 51:                                                       Unique ID for Sample, values must be unique and non missing in this table
#> 52:                                                       Unique ID for Sample, values must be unique and non missing in this table
#> 53:                                                                                  Unique ID for organization who owns the sample
#> 54:                                                                              Unique ID for organization who analyzed the sample
#> 55:                                                                      Unique ID for organization who reported the sample results
#> 56:                                                                                           Latitude of sample in decimal degrees
#> 57:                                                                           Latitude of sample in decimal degrees cannot be blank
#> 58:                                                                                          Longitude of sample in decimal degrees
#> 59:                                                                                          Longitude of sample in decimal degrees
#> 60:                                                                 Sample Collection Start Date Time in Year-Month-Day 24hr format
#> 61:                                                                   Sample Collection End Date Time in Year-Month-Day 24hr format
#> 62:                                                                           Volume of sample (L), must be between 1 and 1,000,000
#> 63:                                                                                            Volume of sample (L) cannot be blank
#> 64:                                                                       Sample type must be one of Blank, Spike, or Environmental
#> 65:                                                                                        Matrix must be one of the allowed values
#> 66:                                      SiteName should describe the site with a name relevant to the project and should not be NA
#> 67:                     MatIDThreshold should describe the hit quality threshold used to determine whether or not an id is certain.
#> 68:               SpikedRecovery should describe the percentage of particles recovered using spiked recovery experiments from 1-100
#> 69:                                                     Spatial file for where the samples were collected should be a geojson file.

#>  3:                                                                                                                                                     SampleID %in% c("23jreh334")

#> 10:                                                                                                                                            NonplasticPolicy  %in% c("Yes", "No")
#> 11:                                                                                                                                           SealedEnvironment  %in% c("Yes", "No")

#> 17:                                                                                                                                                           !is.na(FilterPoreSize)
#> 18:                                                                                                                         in_range(as.numeric(FilterPoreSize), min = 1, max = 100)
#> 19:                                                                                                                                   VisIDMethod %in% c("Visual Microscopy", "SEM")
#> 20:                                                                                                                                                           !is.na(VisualSoftware)
#> 21:                                                                                                                                             PickingStrategy %in% c("Dry", "Wet")
#> 22:                                                                                                                      in_range(as.numeric(VisMagnification), min = 1, max = 1000)
#> 23:                                                                                                                                    MatIDMethod %in% c("FTIR", "Raman", "PyGCMS")
#> 24:                                                                                                                                                            !is.na(MatIDSoftware)
#> 25:                                                                                                               in_range(as.numeric(MethodDetectionLimit), min = 1, max = 1000000)

#> 28:                                                                                                                                                            is_unique(ParticleID)

#> 32:                                                                                                                                                                 !is.na(SampleID)
#> 33:                                                                                                                   grepl("(\\\\.jpg$)|(\\\\.png$)", PhotoID, ignore.case = TRUE) 
#> 34:                                                                                                                                                                  !is.na(PhotoID)
#> 35:                                                                                                                     grepl("^ftp|^http|^https|^www", PhotoID, ignore.case = TRUE)
#> 36:                                                                                                                                                                !is.na(SpectraID)
#> 37: grepl("(\\\\.csv$)|(\\\\.asp$)|(\\\\.spa$)|(\\\\.spc$)|(\\\\.jdx$)|(\\\\.rds$)|(\\\\.qs$)|(\\\\.json$)|(\\\\.yaml$)|(\\\\.zip$)|(\\\\.[0-999]$)", SpectraID, ignore.case = TRUE)
#> 38:                                                                                                                   grepl("^ftp|^http|^https|^www", SpectraID, ignore.case = TRUE)
#> 39:                                                                                              !is.na(FinalAnalysisDate) & !is.na(as.Date(FinalAnalysisDate, format = "%Y-%m-%d"))
